name: release-name-modifier
description: Update your release name with pull request source branch name
author: Arthur Faria

inputs.name: justReturn
inputs.label: Just return variables and do nothing
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, only return output variables and not modify anything

inputs.name: releasename
inputs.label: Release Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: New Release Name. %sourcebranch% will insert the source branch name. **Make sure it is unique!**

inputs.name: enablecomment
inputs.label: Comment on Pull Request?
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, will try to comment on Pull Request.

inputs.name: commentonce
inputs.label: Comment only once?
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, will verifiy if same comment exists before adding another comment.

inputs.name: comment
inputs.label: Comment
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pull request auto comment. %sourcebranch% will insert the source branch name

inputs.name: getDefaults
inputs.label: Get Parameters from Release
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, will try to get ProjectId, RepoId and branches from environment variables.

inputs.name: sourcebranch
inputs.label: Source Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Origin branch of Pull Request   - On Build Pipelines: $(Build.SourceBranch)   - On Release Pipelines: $(Build.SourceBranch)

inputs.name: targetbranch
inputs.label: Target Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target branch of Pull Request   - On Build Pipelines: $(System.PullRequest.TargetBranch)   - On Release Pipelines: $(Build.PullRequest.TargetBranch)

OutputVariables.name: PRSOURCEBRANCHNAME
OutputVariables.description: Name of the source branch as used in replacing %sourcebranch%.
